source_sentence: 佛說摩利支天菩薩陀羅尼經
translation: Dhāraṇī of the Bodhisattva of the Maricī Heaven

source_sentence: 大興善寺三藏沙門不空奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial order from the Tripiṭaka of Daxingshansi, Shaman Bhikong
Thus I have heard.

source_sentence: 一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 與大阿羅漢千二百五十人俱。
translation: He was accompanied by twelve hundred and fifty great arhats.
There was also a limitless multitude of great bodhisattvas.
Maitreya was the bodhisattva.
Mañjuśrī Bodhisattva.
Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva.
They were the chief.
He was accompanied by the Maricī gods and other gods.
They were surrounded by dragons and the eight groups of gods, both front and back.
Śāriputra then rose from his seat.
He bared his right shoulder and knelt on his right knee.
He put his palms together and bowed his head to the Buddha.
He said to the Buddha.
"Bhagavān, in the future ...

source_sentence: 末世眾生作何等法得脫諸難。
translation: What will be the method by which sentient beings in the latter age will be freed from the difficulties?
The Buddha told Śāriputra.
"Listen closely! Listen closely!
Now, I will explain this matter for you.
At that point, the crowd rejoiced and jumped for joy.
They repeatedly urged the Buddha to do so.
It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks.
"A few days ago, there was a god.
It was called Maricī.
He had great supernormal powers and an unimpeded method.
He always travels before the sun.
The sun doesn't see him.
He can see the sun.
No one can see it.
No one can know it.
No one can catch it.
No one can harm [them].
No one can deceive [them].
No one can bind them.
No one can debt their property.
There's no one to punish.
I'm not afraid that a resentful person will get an advantage over me.
The Buddha told the monks.

source_sentence: 若有人知彼摩利支天名者。
translation: "Suppose someone knows the name of that Mārīcī heaven.

source_sentence: 彼人亦不可見亦不可知。
translation: That person can't be seen or known.
He can't be caught and can't be harmed.

source_sentence: 亦不為人欺誑亦不為人縛。
translation: He won't be deceived by others, and he won't be bound by others.
Nor will he be indebted for someone's property.
Nor will he be chastised by others.
Nor will he get an advantage over a rival.
The Buddha told the monks.

source_sentence: 若善男子善女人知彼摩利支天名者。
translation: "If good sons and good women know the name of that Mārīcītian, they should say this.
They should say this.

source_sentence: 我弟子某甲知彼摩利支天名故。
translation: 'That's because my disciple, Mr. A, knows the name of that Mahārīcīpta Heaven.
No one can see me.
No one can know me.
No one can catch me.
No one can harm me.
No one can deceive me.
No one can bind me.
No one can debt my property.
No one can chastise me.
Nor will I obtain an advantage for a grudge against me.
This dhāraṇī has great supernormal powers.
It accomplishes what it sets out to do.
It destroys all evil.

source_sentence: 若用結界百由旬內一切諸惡無敢入者。
translation: If I use this dhāraṇī for a hundred leagues, none of the evils within it will dare to enter.
It was then that the Bhagavān spoke the spell, saying.

source_sentence: 南無佛陀耶(一)南無達摩耶(二)南無僧伽耶(三)怛姪他(四)遏囉迦末斯(五)摩囉迦末斯(六)蘇途末斯(七)支鉢囉末斯(八)摩訶支鉢囉末斯(九)摩利支夜末斯(十)安怛陀那夜末斯(十一)那謨粹都底(十二)莎訶(十三)王難中護我。

He'll protect me in the midst of a thief's troubles.
He protects me on the road.
He protects me when I'm lost on the road or in the wilderness.
He protects me by day and guards me by night.
He protects me by night.
He protects me in a water disaster.
He protects me in a fire disaster.
He protects me in the midst of a Rāṣṭrapāla disaster.
The Chahīnī demon protects me in the midst of difficulty.
He protects me in the midst of poisonous drug difficulties.
The true words of the Buddha protect me.
The true words of the Dharma protect me.
The saṃgha truly speaks to protect me.
The gods truly say [something] to protect me.
The sages truly say, 'Protect me!'

source_sentence: 若有人識彼摩利支天菩薩者。
translation: "If anyone knows that bodhisattva in the Maricī Heaven.
He'll remove all the obstacles and difficulties, the king's difficulties and the thief's difficulties.
He'll remove all the difficulties of fierce animals, venomous insects, and other difficulties.
Difficulties like water and fire.
If someone wants to practice this teaching, they'll find it the most superior of all teachings.
This is the most excellent of all dharmas.

source_sentence: 持此呪者面向百踰闍那。
translation: He'll face a hundred yojanas if he holds this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 一切鬼神惡人無能得其便者。
translation: All spirits and evil people won't be able to get an advantage over them.
When he's practicing in the midst of difficulty, he recites the previous dhāraṇī in the morning.
In the morning, he rises and recites the preceding dhāraṇī.
He recites a spell for a handful of water.
It's scattered in all directions and sprinkled on himself.

source_sentence: 若衣襟若衣袂若袈裟角。
translation: Whether it's a lapel, a robe, or a horn of the reddish-brown robes, the mantra is spread out in three different directions.
Each dhāraṇī and knot is made into a total of three knots.

source_sentence: 即往難中行連誦前二大呪而行。
translation: He then goes out into the midst of difficulty and recites the first two great mudras together.

source_sentence: 所有一切事難軍防主者悉皆迷醉。
translation: All the people who face difficulties, armies, and guardians are deluded.
They don't even know it.
After the Buddha spoke this sūtra, he told the monks and nuns.
He told the monks and nuns.
"Upāsaka, Upāsikā.
"The king, ministers, and people heard that the Buddha said this was Mārīcīyadeva.

source_sentence: 聞佛說是摩利支天陀羅尼。
translation: They heard the Buddha teach this dhāraṇī of the Mārīcī Heaven.
He wholeheartedly accepts it.

source_sentence: 是人不為一切諸惡所害。
translation: That person won't be harmed by any evil.
Monks, suppose there's someone who can write, recite, memorize, and uphold it.
He writes, reads, recites, and memorizes it.
If he puts it in a topknot or in his clothing, he'll recite it.
If he puts it in his robe, then he'll carry it according to his body.
He walks around with his body.

source_sentence: 一切諸惡悉皆退散無敢當者。
translation: All evil [activities] will be scattered, and there's no one who dares to take them on.

source_sentence: 是諸四眾天龍八部禮佛而退。
translation: The four groups of gods, dragons, and the eight orders then bow to the Buddha and retire.
They rejoice and hand down the offerings.

source_sentence: 佛說摩利支天菩薩陀羅尼經
translation: Sutra of the Dhāraṇī for the Bodhisattva of the Maricī Heaven
